thoughts.text: I think I should use the 'list_files' command with the argument 'directory' set to '.' to ensure that the 'rock_simulation.py' file was successfully deleted. Then, I can use the 'execute_shell' command to check if there are any running instances of the script.
thoughts.reasoning: By using the 'list_files' command, I can check if the 'rock_simulation.py' file was successfully deleted. If it is still present, I will need to delete it again. Then, by using the 'execute_shell' command, I can check if there are any running instances of the script, which could cause issues for future simulations.
thoughts.plan:
- Use the 'list_files' command with the argument 'directory' set to '.' to check if the 'rock_simulation.py' file was successfully deleted.
- If the file is still present, delete it again.
- Use the 'execute_shell' command to check if there are any running instances of the script.
thoughts.criticism: I should have been more careful when running the rock simulation script to ensure that it was properly deleted and not causing any issues. I will need to be more mindful in the future.
